name: Molasses' Perpetual Sandbox
description:
What is this game?

Molasses' Perpetual Sandbox  is a game based on community mods.  Molasses' Perpetual Sandbox contains a simple character controller, along with HelloMeow's ModTool. 

With the help of those two important assets; Perpetual Sandbox has become an infinitely playable, and entertaining project. You can easily load or create Unity scenes for Perpetual Sandbox. Unity scenes can be something as simple as a roleplay map or an entire open-world game.  

The game is comparable to something like Roblox, Garry's Mod, or Minecraft.  Though, its much more powerful. Roblox, Garry's Mod, and Minecraft all use out-dated and difficult to mod engines. Perpetual Sandbox fixes that issue by relying on Unity for its engine.

Put simply; Perpetual Sandbox is a sandbox game meant for loading maps, and other games. These maps, and games are called mods.

Note: The game is still early in development, though! There will be a lot of bugs. How do I load a mod?

Simply download a mod built for Perpetual Sandbox, then place it in the game's mods folder.  Feel free to drag as many mods into the folder as you want. All mods in this folder will load as soon as you start singleplayer!

Without any community mods the game is very bland, it'll only load the player.  Checkout the community Discord server for the main source of mods.

Most mod creators do not keep other creator's mods in mind. Be careful when mixing mods!
